column4: how come in the installation of ubuntu it does not give you the option to create a swap partition??
well I see primary and logical
I was going step by step on the ubuntu site
but nowhere in the partition disks menu do I see create partition or swap.
the default install actually doesn't allow for installing without a swap      or at least it isn't easy to continue.
It created a logical partition of 8MB???
looks like Ubuntu created an 8MB logical swap partition on its own
I see.... #6 logical 8.2MB.....underneath that I see pri/log 10.5 GB FREE SPACE
how much free disk space did you have ?
there is an app in the repos that will create and use a swap file if and when needed.   you might want to install without swap and use that, just a thought....
